Module it.polimi.ingsw

Package it.polimi.ingsw.common.event

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AbstractEvent
    An event may be generated by the View, the Model or the Controller Events may be sent from the server or from a client Events sent by clients have a sender, the player who sent the message The model may send client-sent events to other clients, in which case the sender is the same as the original sender Events sent by the model may be sent to more than one player by specifying receivers
    AbstractPlayerEvent
    Abstract class for events which concern the player
    AbstractWorkerEvent
    Abstract class for events which concern the worker
    AbstractWorkerInteractEvent
    Abstract class for events which concern the worker interactions
    PlayerChallengerSelectFirstEvent
    Event for the first player selection by the challenger View -> Model Model -> View
    PlayerChallengerSelectGodsEvent
    Event for the god selection by the challenger View -> Model Model -> View
    PlayerChooseGodEvent
    Event for the god choice by the player View -> Model Model -> View
    PlayerCreateRoomEvent
    Event send by a player that wants to create a new room View -> Model
    PlayerEndTurnEvent
    Event for the turn end View -> Model
    PlayerJoinRoomEvent
    Event sent by a player that wants to join a room View -> Model
    PlayerLoginEvent
    Event sent by a player that has just connected This event is the only event accepted when the player is not identified It's used to pair the player to it's server connection View -> Model
    PlayerLogoutEvent
    Event sent by the view to notify a player disconnection This event may be sent by the client or sent directly from the server implementation View -> Model
    PlayerLoseEvent
    Event for a player defeat Model -> View
    PlayerPingEvent
    Event sent by the player to notify that the connection is still working Sent in response to a RequestPlayerPingEvent View -> Model
    PlayerTurnStartEvent
    Event for the turn start Model -> View
    PlayerWinEvent
    Event for a player victory, ends the game PlayerWinEvent#getPlayer() may return null if there's no winner Model -> View
    WorkerBuildBlockEvent
    Event for a worker block built View -> Model Model -> View
    WorkerBuildDomeEvent
    Event for a worker dome built View -> Model Model -> View
    WorkerForceEvent
    Event for a worker force move View -> Model Model -> View
    WorkerMoveEvent
    Event for a worker movement View -> Model Model -> View
    WorkerSpawnEvent
    Event for a worker spawn View -> Model Model -> View
